subject: Re: Junit logger
msgSnippet: Yes, I ma running selenium tests from Jenkies... So, as I said I would like to log few info in the log file produced by junit. Cheers
messageBody:
Yes,
I ma running selenium tests from Jenkies...

So, as I said I would like to log few info in the log file produced by junit.

Cheers

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> turturiellomartino,
>
> How are you running the Selenium tests? Sorry for all the
> questions--JUnit does not have a built in notion of a "log file", so
> the way to affect which logs you're capturing depends on how the tests
> are being run. Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
> On Fri, Jun 17, 2011 at 4:18 AM, turturiellomartino
> <turturiellomartino@...> wrote:
> > Hi there,
> >
> > I am running Â selenium tests, and I would like to add to the Junit log file status info like, opening page www.xxx.com, clicking on xxx, and so on.
> >
> > So, when a test fails I can get all the info that I need to know the status of the failed test.
> >
> > Thanks guys!
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Bill Venners <bill@> wrote:
> >>
> >> Hi,
> >>
> >> Can you elaborate on what kind of info you need to add?
> >>
> >> Thanks.
> >>
> >> Bill
> >>
> >> On Tue, Jun 14, 2011 at 12:43 AM, turturiellomartino <
> >> turturiellomartino@> wrote:
> >>
> >> >
> >> >
> >> > Hi All,
> >> >
> >> > I hope someone can help me... ;-p
> >> >
> >> > I need to log more info into the Junit4 report, so I would like to know how
> >> > to do it at run time.
> >> >
> >> > There is any way to attach the junit listener and inject additional info?
> >> >
> >> > Cheers!
> >> >
> >> >
> >> >
> >>
> >>
> >>
> >> --
> >> Bill Venners
> >> Artima, Inc.
> >> http://www.artima.com
